content: I had to miss the part of today's TSC call where we reviewed FMG's "git policy", but it looks from the minutes like this didn't go over well. For me, this is a microcosm of the "how do accelerators accelerate" question.

Sounds like it will come back to us for clarification; my main concern here is that we need flexibility during the "diverge and explore" part of spec development, where we try out a bunch of ideas in parallel prior to bringing a proposal back to the workgroup for a vote. That process is really well served by detailed issue tracking (ideally close to the code, focused on/around PRs).
We'll should try get @Bryn Rhodes or @Wayne Kubick on an FMG call for this follow-up, to make sure we've got the TSC perspective in all its nuance.
